triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on UAV swarms as the primary subject and examines their infrastructure, capabilities, and applications.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Swarm robotics forms the theoretical foundation for collaborative autonomy and multi-robot coordination discussed throughout the paper.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Coordinated path planning is identified as a key area for UAV swarms to navigate and coordinate their movements.

triples.name: Assignment problem
triples.relevance: Task assignment is examined as a critical component of UAV swarm coordination and resource allocation.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: AI is highlighted as a key technology integrated into UAV swarms to improve decision-making and adaptability.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is identified as a critical methodology for enhancing UAV swarm autonomy and intelligent behavior.

triples.name: Autonomous robot
triples.relevance: Autonomous robots form the basis for understanding the autonomous capabilities and collaborative behavior of UAV swarms.

triples.name: Surveillance
triples.relevance: Surveillance is discussed as a primary military and civilian application of UAV swarms.

triples.name: Aerial robotics
triples.relevance: Aerial robotics provides the technical foundation for understanding UAV design, control, and autonomous flight capabilities.
